elinor.name: Elinor Bawnik
elinor.title: Lead Therapist, LMFT
elinor.shortBio: With years of experience in individual and couples therapy, I create a safe space for growth and healing through evidence-based practices and genuine human connection.
education: Master of Arts in Clinical Psychology, Antioch University Los Angeles
Bachelor of Arts in Psychology, University of California, Los Angeles
elinor.background: I am a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist dedicated to providing a safe and nurturing space for individuals and couples on their journey toward healing and growth. With a multicultural background and extensive experience in cross-cultural therapy, I bring a unique perspective to my practice.
elinor.approach:
My therapeutic approach combines various evidence-based methods tailored to each client's unique needs. I integrate:

• Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)
• Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT)
• Mindfulness-Based Approaches
• Attachment-Based Therapy
• Solution-Focused Therapy

I believe in creating a collaborative therapeutic relationship where we work together to identify patterns, develop coping strategies, and work toward your goals.

michael.name: Dr. Michael Chen
michael.title: Therapist, LMFT
michael.shortBio: Specializing in family dynamics and trauma recovery, helping clients find strength through challenging life transitions.
education: Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology, Stanford University
Master of Science in Psychology, Columbia University
michael.background: As a licensed therapist with extensive experience in trauma and family dynamics, I specialize in helping individuals navigate complex life transitions and relationship challenges. My approach combines Eastern and Western therapeutic practices to provide comprehensive care.
michael.approach:
I utilize an integrative approach that combines:

• Psychodynamic Therapy
• Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)
• Mindfulness Practices
• Cultural Humility
• Trauma-Informed Care

My style is collaborative and warm, focusing on building a strong therapeutic alliance while maintaining professional boundaries and evidence-based practices.
